content.SCANLAN: ScanLan è un potente strumento che mostra visivamente i dettagli della rete a cui ti stai connettendo, permettendoti di vedere come è strutturata la rete, così come tutti gli indirizzi IP disponibili sulla LAN. Sebbene una rete sia molto grande non significa che abbia più sicurezza di una piccola rete. La sicurezza della LAN dipende dalla configurazione di essa. [Regole] Nella rete puoi trovare, oltre a computer, anche router, switch e hub. L'azione di simulazione del ping ti aiuterà a sapere quali parti della rete puoi raggiungere dalla macchina corrente. Il comando ping è disponibile anche dal terminale. È possibile eseguire il ping di qualsiasi computer sulla rete il cui gateway è un router. Se il gateway è uno switch o un altro computer, è possibile eseguire il ping solo se si è nella stessa sottorete. Puoi anche eseguire il ping tra dispositivi direttamente come router o switch. [Firewall hardware] Un firewall configurato su un router o uno switch impedirà il passaggio di qualsiasi connessione se è presente una regola DENY che influisce sulla connessione. Questo vale per qualsiasi firewall che si trova tra l'origine e la destinazione. La regola ALLOW ha la precedenza sulla regola DENY, quindi anche se un firewall ha una regola DENY di qualsiasi indirizzo e qualsiasi porta configurata, lascerà passare la connessione che corrisponde alla regola ALLOW, se esiste. Il comando ping non è bloccato dal firewall, quindi puoi sapere se puoi raggiungere una macchina nel caso in cui non ci fosse alcun firewall a impedirlo. [Hubs] Gli hub si connettono ai dispositivi esclusivamente fisicamente, quindi gli hub non hanno un indirizzo IP, poiché servono a propagare e organizzare le connessioni ai dispositivi ad essi collegati. Ma gli hub sono più insicuri degli switch o dei router contro gli sniffer. Se uno sniffer è in ascolto su un computer connesso a un hub, riceverà pacchetti di rete da qualsiasi altro dispositivo connesso allo stesso hub. [Router LAN] All'interno della rete locale, alcuni router potrebbero avere il modulo wifi attivato, consentendo di connettersi ad altre macchine in modalità wireless all'interno della rete. Queste reti non sono elencate nel comando iwlist poiché non sono connessioni ad accesso pubblico. Le informazioni bssid e essid possono essere trovate in ScanLan o tramite i metodi di scripting router.bssid_name e router.essid_name. [Switch] Gli switch sono molto simili ai router, tranne per il fatto che non hanno un modulo Wi-Fi o una configurazione di port forwarding. Inoltre, a differenza dei router, non instradano le connessioni ai computer collegati, quindi è possibile accedere ai computer solo dietro uno switch se ci si trova nella stessa sottorete.

content.TUTORIAL_REMOTE_CONN12:
Si consiglia di copiare il programma <color=#0FABFFFF>ScanLan</color> sulla macchina remota ed eseguirlo.
<color=#0FABFFFF>ScanLan</color> è un potente programma che mostra la configurazione di <color=orange>rete</color> in cui si trova il computer.

È particolarmente utile per risolvere le <color=#33cccc>missioni</color> e sapere quale è la macchina della vittima in base al suo <color=#33cccc>indirizzo locale</color>, dato che è indicato nei dettagli delle <color=#33cccc>missioni</color>.

Tieni presente che quando esegui la scansione di un indirizzo pubblico con <color=#0FABFFFF>nmap</color>, potrebbe non mostrarti tutti i computer sulla <color=orange>LAN</color> che hanno servizi attivi, poiché alcuni computer non avranno la porta <color=orange>configurata</color> sul router e quindi non saranno visibili dall'esterno .

Per accedere a questi computer, dovrai prima accedere a qualche altra macchina che abbia una porta aperta verso l'esterno, o ottenere un accesso <color=orange>shell</color> al router, e da lì arrivare alla macchina sulla <color=orange>LAN</color>.

Puoi vedere maggiori dettagli su <color=#0FABFFFF>ScanLan</color> nel <color=#0FABFFFF>Manuale</color>.
content.MISSION_TIP_NOPORTS: Tieni presente che se l'indirizzo pubblico non ha porte aperte, dovrai hackerare il router e da lì entrare nella rete locale per raggiungere la vittima.

content.FILE_MISSION_6:
You've come a long way, but you still have one last chance to regret it.

If you want to continue, there is no turning back. Anyone who collaborates with us must keep a low profile, this means that you must leave your job, your family and friends, everyone. Without goodbyes, go away. We take care of the rest.

If you want to forget all this and get on with your life, now is the time to do it. Just stop reading, delete this user and you will never hear from us again.

Don't go to work tomorrow.
Take the first bus that leaves the city from 8:00 onwards.
Sit at the end of the bus.
After several stops, a woman with a tattoo of a chess horse will board the bus.
Get off at the same stop as her and follow her at a distance of a few meters.
She knows you are following her, but DO NOT talk to her.
You will arrive at a parking lot where a car will be waiting for you, from there they will take you to your new home.
At home you will find your new identity data and a computer, connect to this computer from there to receive the next instructions.

content.FILE_LORE_1:
In 1972, the UNIX operating system was rewritten in the programming language C, opening the possibility for other programmers to create their own operating system variants. 

During the following years different companies bought licenses in order to distribute their own versions of the operating system. Despite the great popularity of Linux after its creation in 1992, and despite it being open source, it was eventually surpassed by a similar operating system with certain peculiarities.

In 1994 the company Neurobox published its closed source operating system called Ellipse along with an SDK. To date, the names of the programmers behind the project have not been made public. Although the system was initially derived from UNIX, the changes to the source were so substantial that it is now considered a system similar to UNIX, rather than a branch of it.
content.FILE_LORE_02:
Last Thursday night, the murder of Jessie Rees, a computer programmer linked to the development of the popular Ellipse operating system, was reported. 

Although Neurobox never made the names of the people involved public, police investigators suspects that Jessie Rees was affiliated with the company for several years. 

The police are not sharing any other details at this time, but this investigation could potentially expose new information about this secretive company and its popular operating system.
content.FILE_LORE_03:
Every time Jessie Rees is talked about, more questions arise about what really happened.

Neurobox quickly dissociated itself from the problem, police said that after a "thorough" investigation nothing had been found that could link the company to the death of Jessie Rees. This was only two days after.
The case was eventually closed as a suicide, although there was some evidence that did not fit, such as that the handwriting on the note did not correspond to Rees' handwriting, as well as the glass that had recently been replaced in the front door.

He was hired by Neurobox and moved into the facilities they have available to employees. According to some documents found in Rees' house, this seems to have been an essential requirement to be able to work in the company.

As it was later revealed, Rees had been one of the engineers in charge of designing the Ellipse kernel, but certain problems with the company, the details of which have not been disclosed, led to his dismissal shortly before Ellipse was released to the public.
content.FILE_LORE_04: Report Test number 2147 - Qlab 12 After solving the refrigeration problem, an average fidelity of 99.996% has been achieved. It is expected that we reach an even greater average in the coming months. This can leave any encryption and security model obsolete in a matter of weeks, including ours. We are not prepared to open the system and I will insist again to keep these tests in a private environment until we have a secure migration plan.
content.FILE_LORE_05: Report Test number 3542 - QLab 04 The simulations have been impressive. Julia's idea worked to perfection, and we have been able to recreate areas outside the field of vision up to several kilometers with 99.78% efficiency. I know this comes out of the initial goal we had on the project, but I think it would be interesting to see how far we can go. I understand the ethical problems that this presents but we can not ignore what we just got. We are waiting for confirmation to continue with the tests.

content.FILE_LORE_06:
Ellipse was conceived to mainly be used in the corporate sphere, and its strengths were security and portability since it was possible to install the system in different architectures with few changes to the code. To achieve this, the whole system was rewritten in a programming language called Greyscript along with its own closed source compiler. Its peculiar implementation made it really difficult to infect or exploit, in part because nobody managed to create a reliable decompiler for Greyscript. 

In a cryptic message released on the web in 1996, the company announced that Ellipse where to be made available for both personal and commercial use completely free without any licensing. The secrecy surrounding Neurobox along with several cryptic messages published by the company, has spawned numerous theories about the company’s origin and agenda while also boosting the popularity of the operating system.
content.FILE_LORE_07:
In 1998 the first major vulnerability in Ellipse was discovered, this vulnerability had been exploited for months until it was discovered, which led to harsh criticism of the company. Their response was the last public message by the company to date: 

“Everything under control”

Less than 24 hours later a patch was released that fixed the vulnerability. Since then, new vulnerabilities keep appearing, several of which have been connected to corporate espionage and bank heists among other things. To this day the company is stuck in a perpetual cycle of finding and patching these never-ending flaws.

One popular theory is that Neurobox themselves are behind the security flaws, but what they would have to gain from doing this and why they continue to patch their system if that were the case, remains unclear. Meanwhile, the many years of silence from Neurobox since the hacking surge began, continue to inspire new conspiracy theories about the company.

content.FILE_LORE_08: Transcript Meeting Nº38. Board of Directors - Neurobox. Thursday 10/10/1996. Andrew: Good morning to all, I know this meeting was not planned... Richard: Can not we have solved this on the phone? Andrew: I'm afraid no, the security of the operating system has been vulnerated. Joana: I thought that could not happen. Andrew: No system is invulnerable but we did not think that they were going to get it so fast Richard: Is it known publicly? Andrew: Not yet, we are trying to negotiate with the exploit author so that he does not publish it, but we do not know how long we can buy his silence. In any case we are only gaining time, if a person has achieved, others will achieve it too. Joana: A lot of money has been invested to develop the system, and in the end it is violated as any other? Are we sure there have been no leaks from an employee? Andrew: We are investigating it, but it can take some time. Richard: Now it does not matter, as soon as it goes to light, it will suppose a decrease in the number of users, and the number of users is not growing as planned. Joana: Well, give away the system for free. Andrew: How free? Joana: The important thing here is the number of users, Ellipse was not created to earn money, we do not have problems of funds, do not lose perspective gentlemen. Andrew: The idea of ​​selling it is to give a vision of quality and reliable product, people give more value to something that has bought than if they have given it to it Richard: Well, that's a somewhat daring affirmation, Linux is free and its number of users is not much less than in Ellipse. Joana: Exactly, also that difference of users is because Ellipse promises security and ease of use. I say that we continue gaining time and make sure that people identify Ellipse as a reliable system during all the time we can. We can always make a damage control at the time. Andrew: I think it's fine, all agree? Richard: I'll take care of talking to the Marketing Department. Andrew: Okay, let us know when you have something. I think we can conclude the meeting.

It is decorated with all kinds of jewelry.") end if if idxAction == 12 then print("While you open the chest an intense light is escaping from its interior and invading the room until you open it completely.") print("The light is blinding but you struggle to look inside") exit(">>>>> $IP_IDX2 <<<<<") end if if idxAction == 13 then print("You look at the light and see that it flutters slightly, it could be the light of a torch") end if if idxAction == 14 then print("The animal shows its teeth while not looking away from you") end if if idxAction == 15 then print("List of available actions: ") for action in helpActions print("- " + action) end for print("Example: look light") end if selectedAction = AskPlayer() idxAction = levelA.indexOf(selectedAction) end while

get_shell.connect_service("$IP_IDX2", 22, "$NPC_IDX0", "$PASS_IDX0")
Prompt = function()
	output = user_input("> ", false, false)
	parts = output.trim.split(" ")

	while parts.len != 3
		if output.trim == "help" then
			print("Operators: + - * /\nExample usage: 2 + 2")
		else
			print("Wrong arguments.\nExample usage: 2 + 2")
		end if
		output = user_input("> ", false, false)
		parts = output.split(" ")
	end while
	return parts
end function

parts = Prompt()
operator = parts[1]
if operator == "+" then
	print(parts[0].val + parts[2].val)
else if operator == "*" then
	print(parts[0].val * parts[2].val)
else if operator == "-" then
	print(parts[0].val - parts[2].val)
else if operator == "/" then
	print(parts[0].val / parts[2].val)
else
	print("Uknown operator: " + parts[1])
end if

You need a valid address that will be shown to users who do not have the currency, indicating where to register. In case of error a string with the details is returned.

The purchase will be finalized if there is any sale offer with a price less than or equal to the one proposed in the purchase. If there is no eligible offer to sell at that time, the offer to buy will remain publicly visible until a new offer to sell satisfies the requirements. If the publication has been successful, true is returned, in case of error a string with the details is returned.
content.DOC_WALLET_SELL_COIN: [Parameters] [1] string currencyName [2] int quantity [3] int UnitPrice [Description] Publish a sale offer indicating the amount of coins you want to sell and the price ($) per unit you want to assign. The sale will be finalized if there is any purchase offer with a price greater than or equal to that proposed in the sale. If there is no existing offer to buy that matches the requirements at that time, the offer to sell will remain publicly visible until a new offer to buy satisfies the requirements. If the publication has been successful, true is returned, in case of error a string with the details is returned.
content.DOC_WALLET_GET_PENDING_TRADE: [Parameters] [1] string currencyName [Description] Returns a list with the pending sale or purchase offer of this wallet of a certain currency. Index 0 of the list represents the type of offer with a string (Buy/Sell), index 1 represents the quantity to be sold or bought, and index 2 represents the price per unit.
content.DOC_WALLET_CANCEL_PENDING_TRADE: [Parameters] [1] string currencyName [Description] Cancel any pending offer of a certain coin.

content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_MAIL:
Cool! You already have an internet connection and you have received your first <color=#33cccc>email</color>.

Throughout the game you will find missions similar to this one, it is important that you read the text carefully as any detail can be of great help.

Click <color=orange>Next</color> when you've read the <color=#33cccc>email</color>.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_MAIL2:
Right now you don't have the tools available on your computer to try to access the objective directly, so other methods will have to be used to achieve it.

[ACTION] Click the Create new email button [/ACTION]
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_MAIL4:
<color=orange>Social engineering</color> is a more useful tool than it seems, if used well it can make things much easier to reach your goal.

In the left column you have a list of predefined emails, each of them with a purpose.

In this mission we need to trick the system administrator by pretending to be the victim so that he gives us the access credentials of his computer.

[ACTION] Select the "<color=#33cccc>Login issues</color>" option [/ACTION]
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_MAIL5:
In social engineering emails you will need to use the correct information in order to trick recipients.

Since the victim works in the same place as the system administrator, you need to know the victim's name to impersonate him.

Fortunately, in the email you received you have the name of the victim, it is enough to use the last name.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_MAIL6:
Although now the problem is that we don't know the email address of the administrator.

To know this information you can use the <color=#0FABFFFF>whois</color> terminal program, which by passing it a public IP address offers some basic information about the network.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_MAIL7:
If the social engineering works you will get the credentials to be able to access the machine remotely using the <color=#0FABFFFF>ssh</color> terminal program.

Keep in mind that the credentials you get now are not the ones asked for in the mission, you need to find the credentials of the victim's <color=orange>email</color> account.

Once inside the victim's computer, you must search through the folders to find the file with the encrypted password and use the program attached to the <color=orange>email</color> to decrypt it.

Good luck!
content.TOOLTIP_MAIL_LOGIN: Login to a different email account
content.INTRODUCTION_WEBS_MANUAL:
If you have an internet connection you can use the browser to search and access different web pages that can offer you different services.

In Multiplayer mode you can also find websites and services made by other players.
content.MAIL_WEBS_MANUAL: Services are offered to register an email address. You can search for it on the web with the Browser using the keyword mail
content.BANK_WEBS_MANUAL: On these websites you can register a bank account. An email address is required. You can search for it on the web with the Browser using the keyword bank
content.SHOPS_WEBS_MANUAL: In these stores you can get some useful programs that are not installed by default in the Operating System. Also if you want to update your hardware from here you can buy any part you need. Keep in mind that all stores have the same catalog. In MultiPlayer mode the stock is updated every month (two real days) while in SinglePlayer mode the stock is updated every time you access the store. You can search for it on the web with the browser using the keyword shop or store
content.HACKSHOP_WEBS_MANUAL:
The administrators of these pages prefer a low profile, so you cannot find them using the browser. You will have to obtain the address by other methods.

On these websites you can find programs as well as exploits that could be used to access certain systems.

In addition, these websites offer missions that you can accept, receiving a payment if you complete them satisfactorily.
Since these missions often require performing illegal actions, completing them results in an increase in your negative karma.

The content of all hackshops is the same and their catalog of exploits are renewed at the same time.
content.POLICE_WEBS_MANUAL: Police websites offer assignments that may require the capture of criminals. They also have a section available to report any crime that you have discovered on your own even if it is not reflected in the mission list. Completing police missions increases your positive karma. You can find these websites using the keyword police
content.ISP_WEBS_MANUAL: At ISPs (internet provider services) you can hire an internet connection or rent servers. These services require a monthly payment, so if this payment is interrupted, the service stops working until the problem with the payment is resolved. In Multiplayer mode, the monthly payment is paused if the player has not logged into the game for 1 real day, the next time the player re-enters the game the monthly payments are resumed. In SinglePlayer mode payouts are paused as soon as the game is closed. To manage these contracted services, the ConfigLan program is used, which you can download from these web pages. You can find these websites using the keywords internet or rental
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_CONFIGLAN:
From here you can manage your servers and your internet connection, if you have hired one.

The first step is to choose a network that you have available and press the connect button.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_CONFIGLAN2: When connecting you will see a new password field; each new device added will use the same root password that the router uses, unless you manually change it after adding the devices using the appropriate commands like passwd.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_CONFIGLAN3: You can add new devices such as routers, computers, and switches to the network in exchange for an increased monthly payment.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_CONFIGLAN4:
In the Monthly payment tab you can see the devices that currently make up the network and their total price.

At the end of the list you can see the total payment of all the hired servers.

The monthly payments of the hired servers or internet are paid at the same time, therefore the more servers you rent or devices you add, the larger the monthly payment will be.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_CONFIGLAN5:
In the event that the payment cannot be made due to insufficient funds in the bank account, all servers will temporarily stop working until you resolve the problem.

If you can not afford all the payment, you can individually restore the servers you want, charging the amount corresponding to the restored server.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_CONFIGLAN6:
To manually restore a server that has been deactivated due to insufficient bank funds, go to the <color=orange>Monthly Invoice</color> tab and click the <color=orange>Restore Payment</color> button.

Make sure you have enough money for this server.
content.TUTORIAL_PAGE_CONFIGLAN7:
If at the end of the next month the total monthly payment still cannot be made, all the servers will be inactive again, so it is a good idea to have hired the services that you know you will be able to afford.

In Multiplayer mode, the monthly payment is paused if the player hasn't logged into the game for 1 real day, the next time the player re-enters the game the monthly payments are resumed. In SinglePlayer mode payouts are paused as soon as the game is closed.

This is all for now, you can now close this window.
content.MANUAL_KARMA:
Every time you complete any mission your <color=orange>reputation</color> will increase allowing you to access new missions or activities.

Also, when solving missions or performing certain actions your karma may change.
Completing Hackshop missions increases your negative karma while performing police missions increases your positive karma.

During the game you can find special missions that are not available on any of these websites in which you can perform extra actions such as notifying the police about a crime or blackmailing the criminal in exchange for your silence, also affecting your karma.

These missions are categorized into two parts: <color=orange>Hidden</color> and <color=orange>Karma</color>

<color=orange>Hidden</color> missions can be found by exploring the world for suspicious files that could lead to a crime, while <color=orange>Karma</color> missions will be notified to you via email after you have reached a certain <color=orange>reputation</color> and will be different depending on the level of karma you have at that moment.

Having a negative karma is not a bad thing, in the same way that having a positive karma does not give any advantage, it is a way to know your current status as a hacker.

You can change your karma at any time by doing missions.
content.MANUAL_GENERAL_TIPS: [ { "title": "", "content": "These are some general tips that can be useful both for accessing certain systems and for protecting yourself from potential attackers." }, { "title": "Hacking networks without ports", "content": "Not all networks have open ports to the outside, so in these cases accessing them can be somewhat more complicated. The most common way to access these networks is to try to hack the router itself, searching for or building an exploit that attacks the kernel_router.so library. Once you have access to the router, it is recommended that you upload the ScanLan program to be able to see the details of the network. From here you will have to reach your target through the local network, jumping from one device to another." }, { "title": "Reverse shell", "content": "Another alternative to closed ports is to use a remote shell, where the victim connects to you instead of you to the victim. To do this you first need to set up an rshell server that will handle receive connections from victims. Once you have the server configured, you should try to get the victim to run a program that makes the connection to your machine without suspecting. To do this, you can use the Social Engineering option "Funny Game" to try to trick the victim by posing as a co-worker. Once the victim has run the program, you will need the rshell-interface program to handle incoming connections." }, { "title": "CCTV", "content": "Some networks, especially the larger ones, may have CCTVs ("closed circuit television") that monitor various interior parts of the building. Accessing these systems is more useful than it seems, as sometimes certain unsuspecting workers may leave information important in view of these cameras. The CCTVs are represented by the icon of a camera in ScanLan. These cameras have an access system through the web, which you can access using the Browser and the IP address of the camera, where you must enter the credentials to access. These credentials are encrypted within the camera's filesystem under the username cctv." }, { "title": "How to avoid being hacked by other players", "content": "There is no single infallible method to achieve this since to obtain good security you have to know the system well and apply different methods depending on the libraries that are installed on your system, as well as any services running such as ssh or http. It is usually a trial and error process until you find the right security on your system, although there are some basic tips you can use to avoid being hacked when you start the game. [Avoid registering your account mail and bank in the first results of the Browser] When you connect to a website, your IP address is recorded in the server logs. Anyone who accesses these logs can see what connections have been made and therefore can reach you, since these first results are the ones that hackers usually review, it is advisable to register on any page that is not among the first results. [Change wifi after visiting certain webs] If you suspect that your IP could be discovered when accessing a system, it is recommended to connect to another Wi-Fi network, so that when any attacker reaches the public IP network you will no longer be there. [Learn to manage the permissions of your file system] The default permissions configured in your Operating System may not be enough to maintain security. It's a good idea to restrict these permissions as much as possible, but of course without locking yourself out of the system. Take a look at the chmod and chown commands to learn more about modifying permissions." } ]
